intro: Phaseolus coccineus subsp. formosus, commonly known as the scarlet runner bean, is a tropical legume native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers and elongated, edible pods. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and compound, with three to five leaflets. The subspecies formosus is distinguished by its more vibrant flower colors and slightly different growth habits compared to other Phaseolus species.
